title.narrative: Winterization assistance for vulnerable populations in Badakhshan and Ghor provinces

description.narrative:
Through this intervention, ACTED will provide lifesaving winterization heating assistance to 606 vulnerable families (4,242 beneficiaries) facing critical climatic conditions during the Afghanistan winter in Badakhshan and Ghor provinces. Due to the extremely low temperatures during winter and the high levels of displacement and poverty across Afghanistan, many households and communities are either living in inadequate or makeshift shelters for the conditions or lack financial resources to provide sufficient heating, therefore exposing them to increased health risks such as respiratory infections, pneumonia and hypothermia, which can be fatal. ACTED is uniquely positioned to provide seasonal winterization support to recent shock-affected households as a priority. Additionally, ACTED aims to build upon the already planned assistance to expand its winterization coverage in the Category 1 provinces of Badakhshan and Ghor. All proposed provinces are subject to extreme cold temperatures, high snowfall, and early onset of winter. As per the ES/NFI cluster targets for winterization, the majority of people in need are host communities, therefore necessitating a needs-based targeting criteria and not status based.
Through the AHF 5th Reserve Allocation, ACTED will aim to expand its winterization targets, adding an additional 606 households. In order to protect the most vulnerable households that are at risk during winter, ACTED will provide standard winterization heating packages, consisting of a one-off 200 USD cash assistance (provided to beneficiaries in Afghani) to cover heating materials for 3 months in Badakhshan, and 260 USD to cover 4 months in Ghor. Assistance will be provided through unconditional, unrestricted cash (200 USD / 15,000 AFN or 260 USD / 19,500 AFN) in accordance with the ES/NFI cluster standards. The winterization cash assistance will be heavily linked with and complemented by multi-sector responses, in order to ensure that beneficiaries’ high multi-sector needs (particularly in food, health and WASH) are met and addressed during the winter months, and that the unconditional winterization cash assistance will contribute to meeting their winterization needs. In total, ACTED will target 375 households in Badakhshan and 231 households in Ghor with winterization assistance.
PDM findings from previous AHF Reserve allocations for similar types of assistance show a strong acceptance of cash as a means of assistance, households will make their own determinations based on their own needs.
To ensure service provision in a dignified manner, ACTED will ensure implementation is conducted while upholding core humanitarian standards and following with ES/NFI cluster guidelines. This project will have a direct impact on reducing protection risks associated with harmful coping mechanisms, in IDP settlements and displacement areas. ACTED will mainstream protection throughout project implementation to prioritize safety and dignity, and avoid causing harm, and to ensure meaningful access and accountability to affected populations.
